case_title: Co-Operation Department vs MUSHTAQ AHMAD (MUSHTAQ ALI)

accussed_details.name: Mushtaq Ahmad (Mushtaq Ali)
allegation: Claim for salary for the period 1-12-1961 to 12-2-1964

complaint_summary: The respondent filed a suit claiming salary for the period 1-12-1961 to 12-2-1964, arguing that it was not a bounty of the State.
investigation_summary: The original suit was filed in the Court of Administrative Civil Judge, Jhang on 9-12-1965 and decreed in favor of the respondent. Subsequent appeals by the appellant were dismissed by the Additional District Judge, Jhang on 11-11-1967.

judgment_summary.main_argument: Salary was no longer a bounty of State during the relevant period.

legal_arguments: The salary for the period in question was not a bounty of the State.
Rights of parties must be adjudicated based on the law prevailing at the time of suit institution.
key_issues: Applicability of the doctrine of bounty to accrued salary
Adjudication based on prevailing law at suit institution

maxims.General Rule: Rights of parties to a suit must be adjudicated upon based on the law prevailing at the date of the institution of the suit.

legal_terms.Doctrine of Bounty: A principle concerning whether salary is considered a discretionary benefit or a legal entitlement.

words_and_phrases.Bounty of State: Refers to discretionary payments by the government, not legally enforceable entitlements.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the respondent's claim for salary during a specific period, initially decreed in their favor by lower courts. The appellant's argument that the salary was a bounty of the State was dismissed, with the tribunal affirming that accrued salary rights must be adjudicated based on prevailing law at the time of suit institution.

key_precedent.principle: Rights of parties must be adjudicated based on the law prevailing at the date of the institution of the suit.
